englishNarrator: Ibn 'Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Nabidh was prepared for Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) in the beginning of the night and he would drink it in the morning and the following night and the following day and the night after that up to the afternoon. If anything was left out of that he gave it to his servant, or gave orders for it to be poured out.

englishNarrator: Ibn 'Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Nabidh was prepared for Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) in the water skin, Shu'ba said: It was the night of Monday. He drank it on Monday and on Tuesday up to the afternoon, and If anything was left out of it he gave it to his servant or poured it out.

englishNarrator: Ibn Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Raisins were steeped in water for the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and he would drink it on that day and on the next day and on the following day until the evening of the third day. He would then order it to be drunk by (other people) or to be thrown away.

englishNarrator: Ibn Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Nabidh was prepared from raisins for Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) in the waterskin and he would drink it on that day and on the next day and the day following and when It was the evening of the third day, and he would drink it and give it to (his Companions) and if something was left over, he threw that away.

englishNarrator: Yahya Abu 'Umar al-Nakhai reported:
hadithEnglish: Some people asked Ibn Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ about the sale and purchase of wine and its commerce. He asked (them): Are you Muslims? They said, Yes. Thereupon he said: Its sale and purchase and its trade are not permissible. They then asked him about Nabidh and he said: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) went out on a journey and then came back and some persons amongst his Companions prepared Nabidh for him in green pitcher, hollow stump and gourd. He commanded it to be thrown away, and it was done accordingly. He then ordered them (to prepare it.) in a water skin and it was prepared in that by steeping raisins in water, and it was prepared in the night. In the morning he drank out of that and on that day and then the next night, and then on the next day until the evening. He drank and gave others to drink. When it was morning (of the third night) he commanded what was left of that to be thrown away.

englishNarrator: Thumama (i.e. Ibn Hazn al-Qushairi) reported:
hadithEnglish: I met 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا and asked her about Nabidh (that was served to the Holy Prophet ﷺ). 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا called an Abyssinian maid (servant) and said: Ask her (about it) for it was he, who prepared the Nabidh for the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ). The Abyssinian (maid-servant) said: I prepared Nabidh for him in a water skin in the night and tied its mouth and then suspended it; and when it was morning he (the Holy Prophet) drank from it.

englishNarrator: A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: We prepared Nabidh for Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) in a water skin, the upper part of which was tied and it (the water skin) had a hole (in its lower part). We prepared the Nabidh in the morning and he drank it in the evening and we prepared the Nabidh in the night, and he would drink it in the morning.

englishNarrator: Sahl bin Sa'd رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Abu Usaid al-Sa'idi رضی اللہ عنہ invited Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) to his wedding feast, and his wife had been serving them on that day while yet a bride. Sahl said ' Do you know what she served as a drink to Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌)? She steeped the dates in water during the night in a big bowl, and when he (the Holy Prophet ﷺ) had eaten food she served him this drink.

englishNarrator: Sahl رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Abu Usaid al-Sa'idi رضی اللہ عنہ came to Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌); the rest of the hadith is the same, but he did not mention this: when he had eaten (the food) she gave him this to drink .

englishNarrator: Sahl bin Sa'd رضی اللہ عنہ reported (this hadith through another chain of transmitters) and he said (these words):
hadithEnglish: In a big bowl of stone, and when Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) had taken the food, she drenched the dates and served (this) especially to him.

englishNarrator: Sahl bin Sa'd رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: An Arab woman was mentioned before Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌). He commanded Abu Usaid رضی اللہ عنہ to send a message to her and he (accordingly) sent a message to her. She came and stayed in the fortresses of Banu Sa'idah. Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) went out until he came to her while she was (at that time) sitting with her head downcast. When Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) talked to her, she said: I seek refuge with Allah from you. Thereupon he said: I (have decided to) keep you away from me. They (the people near her) said: Do you know who he is? She said: No. They said: He is the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌). He came to you in order to give you the proposal of marriage. She said: Then I am the most unfortunate woman because of this (i.e. my defiance). Sahl رضی اللہ عنہ said: Allah's. Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) then set forth on that day until he sat in the Saqifa of Banu Sa'idah along with his Companions. He then said to Sahl رضی اللہ عنہ : Serve us drink. He (Sahl رضی اللہ عنہ) said: I brought out for them this bowl (containing drink) and served them this. Abu Hazim said: Sahl رضی اللہ عنہ brought out this cup for us and we also drank from that. Then 'Umar bin 'Abd al-'Aziz asked him to give that (cup) as a gift to him and he gave (it to) him as a gift. In the narration of Abu Bakr bin Ishaq (the words) are: Sahl رضی اللہ عنہ, serve us drink.

englishNarrator: It was narrated that Ibn Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: I served drink to Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) in this cup of mine: honey, Nabidh, water and milk.

englishNarrator: Abu Bakr Siddiq رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: As we went along with Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) from Mecca to Medina, we passed by a shepherd and Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) was feeling thirsty. He (Abu Bakr Siddiq رضی اللہ عنہ ) said: I milked for him a small quantity of milk (from his goat) and brought it to him (the Holy Prophet ﷺ), and he drank it and I was very happy.

englishNarrator: Al-Bara' رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: When Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) went forth from Mecca to Medina, Suraqa bin Malik bin Ju'shum pursued him. Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ) invoked curse upon him, and his horse sank (in the desert). He (Suraqa) said: (Allah's Messenger ﷺ), invoke blessings for me and I will do no harm to you. He (the Holy Prophet ﷺ) then supplicated Allah. (At that time) he (the Holy Prophet ﷺ) felt thirsty, and they happened to pass by a shepherd. Abu Bakr Siddiq رضی اللہ عنہ said: I took hold of a bowl and milked some milk into it for Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) and gave it to him. He drank it and I was pleased.

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) was presented two cups at Bait al-Maqdis on the night of Heavenly Journey, one containing wine and the other containing milk. He looked at both of them, and be took the one containing milk, whereupon Gabriel (peace be upon him) said: Praise is due to Allah Who guided you to the true nature; had you taken the one containing wine, Your Umma would have gone astray.

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ said:
hadithEnglish: "The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was brought..." a similar report (as no. 5240) but he did not mention in "Iliyah".

englishNarrator: Abu Humaid Sa'idi رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: I came to Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) with a cup of milk from Naqi' which had no cover over it, whereupon he said: Why did you not cover it? - even if you had covered it only with a stick. Abu Humaid said that he had been ordered that waterskins be tied during the night, and the doors be closed during the night.

englishNarrator: Abu Humaid Sa'idi رضی اللہ عنہ reported :
hadithEnglish: The Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) a cup containing milk..." a similar report (as no. 5242). And he (one of the narrators) said: "Zakariyyah did not mention the words of Abu Humaid رضی اللہ عنہ .

englishNarrator: Jabir bin 'Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: We were with Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) and he asked for water. A person said: Allah's Messenger, may we not give you Nabidh to drink? He (the Holy Prophet ﷺ) said: Yes (you may). He (the narrator) said: Then that person went out speedily and brought a cup containing Nabidh, whereupon Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: Why did you not cover it? - even if it is with a wood. He said that then he drank it.

englishNarrator: Jabir رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: A person who was known as Abu Humaid brought for him (the Holy Prophet) a cup of milk from al-Naqi'. Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said to him: Why did you not cover it even with a wood across it?

englishNarrator: Jabir رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: Cover vessels, water skins, close the doors and extinguish the lamps, for the Satan does not loosen the water skin, does not open the door and does not uncover the vessels. And if one amongst you fails to find (something) to cover it well, he should cover it by placing (a piece of) wood across it. Qutaiba did not mention the closing of the doors in the hadith transmitted by him.

englishNarrator: It was narrated that Jabir رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The prophet ﷺ, except that he said: "Cover vessels." And he did not putting a sick across vessels.

englishNarrator: Jabir رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: Shut the doors; the rest of the hadith is the same but with a slight variation of wording: Cover the utensils, and further said: It (the mouse) may set fire to the clothes of the residents of the house.

englishNarrator: A similar hadith (as no. 5245) was narrated from Jabir from the prophet ﷺ. And he said:
hadithEnglish: The mouse may set the house on fire over its inhabitants.

englishNarrator: Jabir bin 'Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) having said: When the wings of the night (spread) or it is night, restrain your children (from going out), for the Satan is abroad at that time, and when a part of the night is passed, free them and shut the doors. making mention of God's name, for the Satan does not open a closed door; and tighten the (mouths of waterskins and mention the name of Allah, cover your utensils and mention the name of Allah even though you should just put something on them, and extinguish your lamps.
